title: Jakob Nielsen and the Usability Revolution
description: One-minute skill: Jakob Nielsen and the Usability Revolution.

hook.text: In 1994, Jakob Nielsen published 10 usability heuristics. They're still the gold standard 30 years later.

buildup.text: Nielsen argued that usability could be measured scientifically â€” not just felt subjectively.

discovery.text: His heuristics include: visibility of system status, error prevention, and recognition over recall.

twist.text: Nielsen found that testing with just 5 users catches 85% of usability problems. Five. Not fifty.

climax.text: His work democratized UX research â€” even small teams could test and improve their products.

punchline.text: Five users and ten rules. That's enough to fix almost anything.

quiz.question: How many users does Nielsen say are needed to find most usability problems?
